model_answer: The presenter advises wiping down tools and checking ink before drafting so as to ensure that everything is in good working order and ready to use. This helps prevent any distractions or delays during the drafting process. The playful cutaways, such as the “HOW TO MAKE A Pencil Sharpener” title card and multiple pencil-sharpening clips, likely relate to this advice by demonstrating some creative and practical ways to use common household items, such as a roll of toilet paper and a pencil, to make a simple sharpener. These elements add an engaging and humorous touch to the video, while also reinforcing the idea of being resourceful and finding solutions with what you have on hand.

The rationale for starting with the lightest linewidth and proceeding by pen size is likely to minimize pen switching and reduce the chance of misplacing tools, saving time. This approach helps ensure that the most precise lines are drawn using the smallest pen, and it reduces the likelihood of error caused by changing pens frequently. The labeled pens and the pen-dropping gag underscore good pen management practices. Answer: A.
